document.contentSummary: Navigate your way through authentic Mexico via Oaxaca’s bustling market stalls, traditional festival food and extraordinary Zapotec archaeological sites.
document.contentBody: [{"type":"paragraph","label":"Paragraph","content":"Navigate your way through authentic Mexico via Oaxaca's bustling market stalls, traditional festival food and extraordinary Zapotec archaeological sites. Recently hit by Mexico's devastating earthquake, Oaxaca has a challenging future ahead of it. However, the state still remains open and travellers are encouraged to continue to visit the colourful state, particularly in such trying times."}]
document.contentGallery: [{"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/GourmetTraveller/2017/08/29/50588/girl.jpg","caption":"With patterns reflecting the local history of the area, woven rugs are made in Oaxaca's Teotitlán del Valle and Santa Ana Del Valle. The lengthy process involves artisans dying their yarn with natural dye before weaving rugs on pedal looms.","title":"Teotitlán del Valle, Oaxaca","open":false,"mediaType":"image","source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"valid":true},{"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/GourmetTraveller/2017/08/29/50587/bread-markets.jpg","caption":"To celebrate Day of the Dead, locals prepare specialty foods, including pan de muerto sweet bread. In Oaxaca the sweet bread is served all year round, however throughout the festival, decorative toppings are added to celebrate lost loved ones.","title":"Oaxaca’s market villages","open":false,"mediaType":"image","source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"valid":true},{"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/GourmetTraveller/2017/08/29/50586/oaxaca.jpg","caption":"The colourful town of Oaxaca is alive with bustling markets and full-flavoured cuisine. Every year the town's locals take to the streets to celebrate Día de Muertos, honouring the dead with late-night vigils and elaborate costumes. The spooky fiesta continues into the early hours of the morning and includes traditional foods and floral tributes.","title":"Oaxaca City","open":false,"mediaType":"image","source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"valid":true},{"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/GourmetTraveller/2017/08/29/50585/santa-domingo-chruch.jpg","caption":"One of Mexico's most stunning examples of Baroque architecture, construction began on the church during the 1550s by the Dominican order. The interior is as impressive as its facade, with intricate 3D gilt designs and gold ceiling detailing.","title":"Convento de Santo Domingo, Oaxaca","open":false,"mediaType":"image","source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"valid":true},{"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/GourmetTraveller/2017/08/29/50583/Palacio-de-Bellas-Artes-in-Mexico-City.jpg","caption":"Diego Rivera and José Clemente Orozco are among the high-calibre Mexican artists who contributed to the impressive murals within the city's grand Palace of Fine Arts. A mash-up of art deco, art nouveau and neo-classical, the building was originally scheduled to open in time for Mexico's centenary celebration of independence in 1910, but instead wasn't completed until 1934. The artistic hub of the city, its innovative design (its interiors are made of Carrara marble) and magnificent grandeur makes it a tourist hotspot.","title":"Palacio de Bellas Artes, Mexico City","open":false,"mediaType":"image","source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"valid":true},{"url":"http://d3lp4xedbqa8a5.cloudfront.net/s3/digital-cougar-assets/GourmetTraveller/2017/08/29/50584/Pyramid.jpg","caption":"Northeast of Mexico City is the holy city of Teotihuacan. Built between the 1st and 7th centuries A.D., the Pyramid of the Sun (pictured) is the site's largest structure. Abercrombie & Kent offers small group tours through the heart of the Mesoamerican spectacle, their Mexico's Day of the Dead Festival journey showcasing the cultural wonders of Mexico City and Oaxaca.","title":"Teotihuacan","open":false,"mediaType":"image","source":"","credits":[],"tags":[],"valid":true}]
